website_summaries.verdict: A solid lens with quick, sharp focus. Great for action shots, portraits, and low-light photography.
pros: An exceptional lens with a 50 mm stepping motor (STM) that's very fast and very quiet
Wide focusing ring is easy to operate quickly
Compact with a fixed focal length
cons: A small amount of users have had defective metal lens mounts

website_summaries.verdict: Excellent image quality in a prime lens for a low price. Offers large aperture for gorgeous portrait photo results; but it has some limitations.
pros: Extremely versatile with a desirable price point
Works especially well for portrait photography
Small lens takes up little room in the bag
cons: No zoom capability will frustrate some photographers

customer_reviews.title: So affordable & perfect lens upgrade!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this lens. I'm a beginner photographer, using a Cannon Rebel T6. I wanted to up my game with depth of field. This lens is amazing for portrait & up close pictures. It's so affordable & the quality turns out great. Would definitely recommend if you're looking for an affordable, easy to use lens to up your photo game.
customer_reviews.author: Katie E. Wodaege

customer_reviews.title: I'm so pleased with the new STM version
customer_reviews.text: I just ordered this lens and I tried it out right away!! I'm a portrait photographer and I've always had a 50mm 1.8 in my bag! My older one was dropped and so I needed a new one! I'm so pleased with the new STM version!! GORG colorful, crisp images!
customer_reviews.author: Avyn

customer_reviews.title: Great For Perfecting Your Craft!
customer_reviews.text: I'm going to be honest when I first bought this I was still a little to use to my other lens and a bit spoiled but after actually taking to the street with this baby...I fell in LOVE! This is great for portraits and everyday in general! It forces you to move around a bit more and great for low light situations!
customer_reviews.author: AveyRose

customer_reviews.title: Great lightweight lens for every day pictures
customer_reviews.text: This is a great lens. It is so easy to run around with and shoot great photos Light-weight, fast focus, and good for low-light situations. With the 1.8 can get great depth of field in your pictures. I also shoot with a 70-200 2.8 and find I've been using this one much more often. Yes it doesn't have all the telephoto but much more light-weight and nimble. Be careful shooting under F2.2 as you will only get a very specific point in focus. Everything else will appear blurry. I usually shoot around 2.8 for good close-up shots.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Shyres

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice lense for Portraits. Really creamy bokeh with this lens. Using it on my SL2. AF is fast but some times can't get a lock on dark objects. Manual focus also works nicely but you have to switch it to MF on the lens only then will it work. Can't use it for video work because no IS. These pics were taken only with my normal room light.
customer_reviews.author: Fadaboey

customer_reviews.title: Amazing deal
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these lenses consistently for a few months now and they've become my go-to's. High quality lenses that perform well for everything I need them to - very very pleased with this little kit!
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra

customer_reviews.title: Greta lens for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This lens is not perfect. But it is very relevant for use in a profesional atmosphere. I use this for my media company and it works out great. And clients say the photos look fantastic! Auto focus is a little noisy, no problem for photos... But for video don't plan on using any audio from the camera or a mic on the hot shoe mount... Maybe a Shotgun mic wouldn't pic up the auto focus noise. I use a lavalier mic, does not pick up the noise. Bottom line: Absolutely worth the money; sharp lens. Best lens ever? No.
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: Vary Good Lenes
customer_reviews.text: These are some nice lenses. I have a EOS T6i camera and it has a crop sensor. Both of these lenses work great with the camera. The 50mm is designed for a full sensor and is primarily used for portraits. On my camera it's closer to an 80mm but is still a great portrait lens. The 10-18mm Ultra Wide Angle is designed for a crop sensor and is used mainly for Landscapes. I've used it around my house and yard but haven't taken it out yet to reallysee what it can do. The pictures I have taken have been terrific. These aren't L series lenses but they are very good everyday lenses.
customer_reviews.author: Eric L. Young

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for new photographers!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this lens after many recommendations. After playing with this lens, this lens is amazing. Perfect for any new/amateur photographers like myself. It's easy to use and you can get some very amazing pictures with some patience. There is no zoom for those who wonder, you are your own zoom! Move forward or backward to get the best focus. I would also not recommend Autofocus, I would use Manual focus just for ease. I highly recommend you purchase this lens for new photographers in your life or for one that doesn't have this lens.
customer_reviews.author: Cory Stephens

customer_reviews.title: Good combo, great price.
customer_reviews.text: Thank you excellent value for money on this package. Both lenses are quite good. Build can be better for 10-18 mm (base groove are plastic instead of metal), but 50 mm is very fine lens at this price. As a combo I can't beat the price and additionally they serve different purpose of photo shooting (wide angle & Close up portrait) which was needed for me as I bought a Canon Camera kit having standard two lenses (18-55, 70-300), hence both are good addition to my standard set of lenses. 50mm one already has too many likes on my facebook page, it captures images like a professional photographer.
customer_reviews.author: VikSin

customer_reviews.title: Great portrait lens for a Canon 90D
customer_reviews.text: As most photographers know, a crop focus sensor like on the Canon 90D (1:6 in this case) means that a 50mm lens gives the same effective frame as a 80mm on a full frame camera. That's perfect for portraits, and this lens is superb at the portraits I have taken. The lens itself is very sharp. The f 1.8 gives is very good low light ability. All in all, this one is a must for any photographer's bag. I'm most happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne P.

customer_reviews.title: ... for an inexpensive Canon lens to give me a nice bokeh effect for my photos and this lens was ...
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for an inexpensive Canon lens to give me a nice bokeh effect for my photos and this lens was perfect for that. For a beginner, my photos now look so much more professional and I'm finding I can get them to look even better with different lighting. This saves me time because for the most part I like taking pictures that don't require much touch-up and that's what I get with this lens.
customer_reviews.author: Denise F

customer_reviews.title: Yes
customer_reviews.text: Very good lens kit for a crop sensor camera. The 50mm will work on crop and full frame. The 10-18 is for crop. Anyway, these lenses are well worth the money. I see people spend more and take worse photos. I absolutely love these lenses. I recently upgraded to the 5d mark iv and I’m sad I can’t use the 10-18. I took some great photos with it. The only thing you gotta look out for on the 10-18 is if you’re using an nd filter or polarizer while closer to 10mm. You will get some natural vignette from the lens picking up the filter. Full speed ahead. Affordable and worth it.
customer_reviews.author: joseph

customer_reviews.title: The optics are great. Bokeh is beautiful
customer_reviews.text: This is the first lens I bought with my Canon 5D Mark IV and it's impressive, especially at this price point. You really can't go wrong. The optics are great. Bokeh is beautiful. The lens is super light. It's made of mostly plastic so it's probably not the most durable lens in the world, but since it's such an inexpensive lens (relatively speaking), it's a non-issue. The only thing I wish it had is the depth of field gauge so I can set it up for zone focus in manual mode.
customer_reviews.author: Dannel A.Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: For amateur photographers who want to take the next step
customer_reviews.text: This was a fantastic deal. I was looking for a wide angle lens ahead of planned trip to Iceland and was over the moon that I could get a "nifty fifty" as part of the deal as well. The 50mm is a major improvement over the kit lens and though it might not be the pinnacle of build quality, it more than suits the needs of this amateur photographer. The ultra-wide is a really fun tool to have too — I was blown away how much it let me squeeze into a frame from up close.
customer_reviews.author: Chester Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Great deal for some worthwhile lenses
customer_reviews.text: Excellent little package. I really wanted the 50mm lense more than any other. When I saw this package I jumped on it due to the savings. I would have eventually gotten both lenses, this was an excuse to get both now. The lenses were packaged well and came in perfect condition. I have shot on both and they gave me great results. I really liked that they have the manufactures warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Ciarimboli

customer_reviews.title: ) and this is just a really great deal for two lenses for amateur photogs
customer_reviews.text: I searched and searched, and you can trust me that I did indeed search (ebay, Craigslist, local stores, online stores...) and this is just a really great deal for two lenses for amateur photogs. Really picky and techy pros would want higher quality, but if you're just the average senior portrait or wedding photog who makes a few hundred dollars per gig and you need a portrait lens, this is a great deal. A solid portrait lens and it's like getting the landscape lens for free.
customer_reviews.author: Donna L. Schillinger

customer_reviews.title: purchase it!
customer_reviews.text: fantastic lens for the money. im somewhat new to photography, but this was recommended by a friend who is semi-professional. for the type of photos i take and use of my dslr it took excellent pictures, i have a canon t3 rebel and worked great with it. mostly had the camera in automatic mode but played with some settings and the pictures still turned out great. would recommend as an everyday home use lens if you are wanting to capture everyday moments not needing a zoom lens. attached are some of the first photos i took with the lens no editing what so ever.
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: The magnificent "Nifty Fifty"
customer_reviews.text: This is the third lens I have purchased for my canon SL3 and I honestly wish I bought this one first, let me explain. The lens is perfect for portrait photography! The depth of field is absolutely stunning! No chromatic aberration, Good image quality its a wonderful lens! The only bad thing I could conjure about this lens ( I had to go out on a limb to find a bad feature) is the auto focus is a tad slower than other lenses but it can be easily overlooked :) overall satisfied with my purchase and I will continue to use this lens for the foreseeable future.
customer_reviews.author: Lorenzo

customer_reviews.title: this 50mm lens is a great thing to add to your camera bag
customer_reviews.text: Without getting into technical specs (there are plenty of reviews focusing more on that), this 50mm lens is a great thing to add to your camera bag, especially if you're just starting out. I'd recommend it as the first non-kit lens that anyone buy. If you are worried about using a prime/fixed lens, don't be. It is rather intuitive and the flexibility in depth of field offered with a f/1.8 aperture is well worth having to take a few steps backward or forward.
customer_reviews.author: gravelsnakes

customer_reviews.title: Most lens for the money
customer_reviews.text: The nifty 50. The fantastic plastic. It's by far the best bang for the buck for any lens for any camera for anybody looking to step up their photography game. It's f1.8 so low light isn't an issue. Autofocus is quick, quiet and accurate. I had this lens, it was my favorite. Moving up the ladder to any f1.4 lens, you'll be spending 2 to 5 times as much for slightly better image quality so if you're a budget photographer then this is the best investment you can ever make.
customer_reviews.author: PeteTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: DOA
customer_reviews.text: I don't like to say I hate it. Perhaps I hated the way it didn't work. I put it on a brand new camera & it kept clicking & not focusing. Took it to my local, dependable camera shop & they confirmed something didn't sound right & that it wasn't working. While I was there, I ended up picking up two other fabulous lenses. Maybe I'll try it again down the road.
customer_reviews.author: Darla Coop

customer_reviews.title: These Lenses did exactly what I needed them to do for the price.
customer_reviews.text: These Lenses are an amazing product and I highly recommend getting them if you have a low budget but still want pro level quality for your pictures. I'm a photographer who takes many portraits for people and the 50mm does a terrific job of giving the exact amount of clearity and sharpness I need for my shots. The 10-18mm is super for those wide shots of groups or landscapes. I really love them both. If you are on the fence about buying one or the other, just get them both now, they really are worth the discount together.
customer_reviews.author: Chandler

customer_reviews.title: Amazing stm 50mm, Amazing Price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this lens for a toss in the back pack lens for good landscape portrait photography. What I discovered was amazingly clear photos even macro, to long. For the price I cannot believe the clarity that I have gotten. I have only worked with the lens twice but will keep updating. I'm stunned. I have a lot of lenses. But this is the best cost for price that I have. Even in manual focus, I thought I might lose something....gained...and I am 71 so sight is not pure, but this is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Ngirilover

customer_reviews.title: STM really makes a big difference! If you’re still EF / EF-S - get this set!
customer_reviews.text: After my M50 items were stolen (except for the body) I ended up buying this set to replace the kit 15-45m & 11-22m EF-Ms I had bought. With the EF to EF-M adaptor it adds a bit of bulk BUT these are fantastic lenses. I love that its a bit wider too at 10m and still has IS. 50m is a great starter prime lens and the 10m really sets you up for vlogging especially if you have dual pixel AF on your body.
customer_reviews.author: Rafael DeAusenTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Crop factor rebel t6
customer_reviews.text: I like the extra capability the lens gives me, as I am a beginner hobby photographer. I am excited to use this lens more! I read about the crop factor before buying it, I’m using a rebel t6, and it definitely is cropped and zoomed in more but it’s been fun to just try other ways to get my pictures to work. But if that’s a problem for you I wouldn’t recommend getting this lens. I also don’t like the cap that much that protects the front of the lens, it feels like it’ll come off easy which annoys me a little but it hasn’t popped off yet so hopefully it’ll just stay on if I’m careful.
customer_reviews.author: Mia Washburn

customer_reviews.title: Only worked for 7 months. Minimal use.
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this lens for 7 months. Minimal use. It's not working anymore. A bit disappointed because I didn't expect it to not work this soon.
customer_reviews.author: R. Romero

customer_reviews.title: it's likely going to be better than anything you already have
customer_reviews.text: For the price, there really is no reason not to get this lens. Really. Unless you have an L lens (or Sigma Art) in this focal length, it's likely going to be better than anything you already have. This lens is plenty sharp, fast, and makes a fairly good portrait lens on crop cameras. It's small enough that finding room in your bad will not be a problem. The STM focusing is nice and smooth, but the focus-by-wire during manual focus takes some getting used to. As others have mentioned, focusing isn't quiet enough to not be picked up by internal mics, but works fine with an external mic.
customer_reviews.author: Michael M.Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING PHOTOS!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm so glad I bought this lens I'm an amateur photographer just getting into portraits and this makes all of my photos look like a million buck. Whomever I'm photographing becomes a model. It's a really good lens for microphotography to. I would HIGHLY ENCOURAGE ANY PHOTOGRAPHER AT ANY LEVEL TO HAVE THIS LENS!!!
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Weston

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase ever!
customer_reviews.text: I debated on this lens for a long time before I actually purchased it. I wish I hadn't waited so long! The bokeh it produces is absolutely beautiful. I am strictly a hobbyist and do mostly Landscapes and Wildlife. Since purchasing this lens and posting what I've taken with it, I've gotten a few requests to do portraits. I actually ended up taking my nephew's prom photos and they turned out gorgeous! I love being able to open the aperture and take photos in low light without cranking the ISO. Every photographer needs to have this lens in their bag.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Great bundle!
customer_reviews.text: These lenses have changed the way I make photos. The 50mm lens is great, luminous and sharp, can be used in a APS-C or in a full frame sensor Canon camera. The wide angle 10 -18 mm lens is great for landscaping photography, sharp images, can only be used on an APS-C sensor Canon camera. If you are a basic to intermediate photographer, you are going to have a lot of fun and satisfaction usig these lenses.
customer_reviews.author: Cliente de Kindle

customer_reviews.title: Must-have lens.
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic update to the venerable "nifty fifty". Image quality is actually better than the 3x more expensive EF 50mm f/1.4 USM. If you're used to USM lenses with full-time mechanical manual focus, STM lenses are a bit of an adjustment - you have to depress the shutter half-way in order to manually focus... the mechanism is electrical, not mechanical. The 49mm filter size is a bit of an outlier compared to other comparable prime lenses, but that's a minor annoyance.
customer_reviews.author: Joe P

customer_reviews.title: Great lens for on-the-go
customer_reviews.text: This is what was expected from Canon, a high quality lens that does what it is suppose to do. There are many other vendors you can choose from, but these guys were really good! The turn around time was very quick, and my lens was packed to ensure absolutely no damage could occur to the product. I wish I could speak more in terms of quality, but I’ll let this portrait of my puppy do the talking.
customer_reviews.author: augdogs

customer_reviews.title: Best $125 I've ever spent
customer_reviews.text: I've decided to actually start investing in my photography hobby. This lens has been such a game-changer. I don't see a reason to not get it. Update: one day later, and I have to give this two stars. The focus has stopped working and the lens is making a lot of noise/effort when auto focusing.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Arboleda

customer_reviews.title: Simply Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Simply amazing! After a search and viewing lot of reviews, I procured from Amazon. Immediately I started taking some test snaps. ... and what I found! A small wonder. Someone rightly said 'Big things come in small packs". Advantage of fixed lengths lens. Sharp pictures, excellent bokeh, silky texture, and so handy. The outstanding product with fast delivery. Do not be misled by price factor. Cheap in price does not mean cheap quality. It is reverse. Cheap price and outstanding performance. Oh! I am searching Amazon whether Canon has some more products like this. Photo hobbyists! Just buy it. An outstanding addition in my Canon camera and lens treasure. Thanks Canon & Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Rajiv Desai

customer_reviews.title: Solid improvements in build.
customer_reviews.text: Good glass. I serious step up from the previous model in the build quality. I had the previous version and the old plastic mount just could not keep up. I go out everyday, I am climbing and crawling sometimes to get the shot I am looking for and the old model just could not cut it. The new improvements make this a solid lens. the only downside is that there is no seal around the ring. I live coastal and have a lot of humidity and sea air. It is not a big deal for the price of the lens and the photos it puts out are great. It just plays into what lens I chose as my primary walker.
customer_reviews.author: I. Fraser

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic lens duo.
customer_reviews.text: The 10-18mm lens is super-wide and opens up a whole new world of possibilities. It's also remarkably sharp and the OIS helps get a stable shot even in moderately low lighting. The 50mm lens is super-bright and has great background blur thanks to that F1.8 aperture. It feels fragile in hand, though, not nearly as solid as the 10-18mm lens (which is also plastic, but doesn't feel as cheap as the 50mm).
customer_reviews.author: mLo68

customer_reviews.title: Not a good lens for concert photography
customer_reviews.text: This does okay in low-light situations, but is awful for concert photography. I photograph at smaller venues and that was the main reason I purchased this lens. There is one distance you can shoot at, which is very limiting, and the lens barely fits on the body of my camera. I almost kept it for shooting portraits because everyone said it was perfect for that, but had issues with that too. When shooting in normal daylight, everything had a weird red tint to it even after I tried to adjust all of the camera settings. I tried to save some money and saw great reviews, but was disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Mina Garagozlo

customer_reviews.title: It is a lot of fun. Has some weird tendencies but I have found ...
customer_reviews.text: I always use L lenses but bought this for my niece's wedding. It is a lot of fun. Has some weird tendencies but I have found that they can be used creatively almost like a special effects lens. I like the results for portraits and while not great from a technical standpoint it is a atmospheric. It is hard not to try to reframe by zooming in but also makes me rethink my framing which got a great picture of dad and daughter during the first dance. I work with the homeless and want to use it for some of their portraits.
customer_reviews.author: BB

customer_reviews.title: LOVE
customer_reviews.text: I looooooove this lens!! I can't give you any REAL feedback as my photography knowledge is limited, but it's perfect for me. Gives a creamy blurred background as I wanted and makes photos look like I'm actually good at photography, despite me doing everything on auto. Great lens and I can't wait to snap some photos my kids with it.
customer_reviews.author: Simone

customer_reviews.title: Nice upgrade from its predecessor
customer_reviews.text: A nice upgrade from the predecessor (the f1.8 v.II), which I found to be very poorly made. This one hasn't fallen apart on me like the 1.8 version II did (2 different copies of that p.o.s.). This one doesn't have that cheap, toy-like feel to it, and it still produces the sharp images that the version I and II were famous for. I do like that Canon has an affordable 50 for budget shooters. Now it seems a lot more reliable.
customer_reviews.author: sumthin

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it!
customer_reviews.text: Seriously, if you own a Canon camera (DSLR or mirrorless, APS-C or full-frame) then you should definitely own this lens. In fact, it should probably be the first lens that is purchased after having a kit-lens that was provided with your camera body. Very sharp, light, and relatively small - a perfect lens to just leave on your camera most of the time! Any potential downsides (not the fastest aperture lens, plastic build) are wiped away by the low cost and very good image quality! Oh, it doesn't come with a lens hood and the Canon OEM hoods are ridiculously expensive. Just find a good third-party hood on Amazon for 1/5 of the cost of the Canon hood.
customer_reviews.author: J. Brown

customer_reviews.title: stunning
customer_reviews.text: i needed a 50mm that is fast focusing and sharp and this fits the bill. wish it was faster aperture than 1.8 but there are no options. unfortunately the higher priced canon f1.4 lens is not sharp at all. sigma 50/1.4 lenses are sharp but wont autofocus well. there are no good focusing 50mm lenses for canon with 1.4 or 1.2 aperture. i need something reliable and fast and this does everything reliably!
customer_reviews.author: VB

customer_reviews.title: No Non-sense lens that makes Sense!
customer_reviews.text: My wife is just experimenting with Bokeh (the art of having your subject in focus with everything else blurred!) She loves this lens. Although it doesn't really help with zoom, I think it's teaching her basic photography skills where you don't focus so much on your camera (tool) but instead work on your 'eye' of things. The lens is huge and brings in a lot of light. This was perfect for cloudy days or dark night scenes, where you don't really want the automatic flash to destroy the mood! This is truly a no-nonsense lens!
customer_reviews.author: Maja B

customer_reviews.title: No way to beat the price for quality. A must-have, however...
customer_reviews.text: SOOOO much good for so little cost! My biggest problem is the manual focus. It's fly-by-wire manual, and subtle changes aren't immediate.... but that's the thing. So much of this lens is so good, and you just expect flawless manual focus. You can ONLY manually focus with the camera on, and when not checked to AF. But..... seriously.... f1.4 or f1.8 on crop sensor..... sure the bokeh isn't $1500 like...... but .... F ONE-POINT-FOUR in full-frame for $100...... sign me the hell up!
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Amazing lens
customer_reviews.text: This lens was recommended by my friend who is a photographer. I needed a new lens that is great to shoot portraits and has a nice bokeh but not too expensive. I know, it is hard to find :) The lens is great for everything I need! I can not believe the price is not higher, honestly. This is the fixed lens, so no zoom, you have to move constantly which is also great. So happy I found something inexpensive and high quality.
customer_reviews.author: VR011

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: I love my new lense! I have to state that I am no pro when it comes to photography, but I have developed an interest in it for some time now. I took a photography class in high school many years ago, and obtained my first canon rebel a year ago. I was using the kit lense, but I felt limited with that. I wanted to experiment with bokeh, and this lense is perfect! Looking forward to using it on portraits!
customer_reviews.author: SavvyShopper

customer_reviews.title: Great prime lens!
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had the full chance to go get some really tough shots with it, but the bokeh is super creamy, it manages to add great depth and make your subject really stand out. The detail is unbelievable and the pictures all come out crisp and smooth. I do recommend opening up your aperture more for bigger subjects as the lens could blur out the edges. The stepping motor is very very loud though, but that doesn't really bother me. For the money, this lens is totally worth the investment from hobbyists to pros.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen DiGiorgio

customer_reviews.title: Great around town lens!
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a professional photographer, but I do know how to control my aperture, shutter speed and ISO. That said, this 50mm prime lenses produces amazing depth of filed (or lack of) when wide open. This nifty fifty lens will help you take better shots because its NOT a zoom lens.. it forces you to move around and get the best shot. Remember if your camera is a crop sensor like mine. this lens is closer to 80mm (Crop sensor = lens focal length X 1.6 = true focal length) 50mm X 1.6 = 80mm
customer_reviews.author: JoeO

customer_reviews.title: Basic but great lens
customer_reviews.text: My communications director wanted to try this lens to see if it would take good pics at meetings; it is awesome. Took a pic of an African violet in my office with the lights off, just some light from the doorway in the room. Looks like daylight. Captures a lot of light and really makes it easy to take quick photos since lighting is not as big an issue as the old big kit lens.
customer_reviews.author: Miguel

customer_reviews.title: It takes some great close up photos and I'm still experimenting with all ...
customer_reviews.text: As my first prime lens, I really am enjoying what you can do with it. It takes some great close up photos and I'm still experimenting with all of the things that it can do. For the price, I can't see how you could go wrong and I'm glad that I made the choice. You just have to remember when taking shots that because its a prime lens you move to or away from the subject as there is no zoom. You are the zoom. The STM works great with my Canon 70D and I'm looking forward to using it much more.
customer_reviews.author: Todd V.

customer_reviews.title: I really enjoyed the ease of use
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoyed the ease of use! This lens gives great photos for the price and has more than paid for itself already. My work is in fine arts and most of the large exhibitions are still poorly lit, not an issue for this lens! It feels well constructed and it is not at all heavy so carrying it for hours is not an issue. The auto focus seems smooth and when tested at home it is quiet. I can see why it's called "The Nifty Fifty"! The only reason I have not given this lens five stars is that I have not owned it long enough, time is where true quality shows itself.
customer_reviews.author: M.A. Tompkins

customer_reviews.title: So this is a nice one to have until I can afford to upgrade
customer_reviews.text: If you've just bought a Canon camera and can't afford a nicer 50mm lens, there's absolutely no reason not to buy this one. It's so incredibly cheap and light (easy to carry). I wish I had gotten it a long time ago. Autofocus is fast. The only complaint I have is that it's not very sharp. But you get what you pay for. I have a Sigma 35mm 1.4 HSM lens which produces much sharper photos. But that lens cost $800. So this is a nice one to have until I can afford to upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: ferret

customer_reviews.title: very good lens for blurry backgrounds any many other types of shots
customer_reviews.text: I use this lens with the Canon Rebel Sl2 and I heard this lens was called the nifty fifty and now i definitely see why. I just started doing photography and i absolutely love this lens. it gives me the perfect blur and i can use it for many other types of shots as well, the build is very solid i love the STM motor in it for that smooth auto focus while taking pictures and shooting video and best of all the price is not a deal breaker, it just right definitely worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: YASURIS MEDINA

product_meta.title: Canon EF 50mm f/1.8 STM Lens
product_meta.description:
Style:50 mm LensThe wide f/1.8 aperture lets in more than 8x the amount of light compared to the standard zoom lens that is provided with your EOS*. This results in sharper images with less motion blur and reduced need to use flash in dimly lit conditions so you can easily capture the atmosphere of a low light environment. The 50mm focal length allows you to fill the frame with your subject from a comfortable distance making it a great lens for portraits. A similar perspective to the human eye and its compact size make the EF 50mm f/1.8 STM a great everyday lens to always carry with your EOS camera. The near-silent STM (Stepping Motor) technology focuses extremely quickly when shooting photos, so you can react suddenly to capture fleeting moments. Creating high quality movies is easier with STM as it delivers steady and quiet continuous focusing, so your movies are smooth, and soundtracks only capture the surrounding sounds and not the noise of a focusing motor. The EF 50mm f/1.8 STM replaces the popular EF 50mm f/1.8 II lens which was affectionately known for giving outstanding picture quality at an affordable price. This latest version gives the same stunning photo quality but with a fast, near-silent focus motor and a more robust build that belies its price.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
 

EF 50MM F/1.8 STM
Compact and lightweight—an outstanding walk-around lens Canon's EF 50mm f/1.8 STM is a great entry into the world of EOS prime lenses. With an 80mm effective focal-length on APS-C cameras, 50mm on full-frame cameras, it's an excellent prime lens for portraits, action, even nighttime photography. Its bright maximum aperture of f/1.8 helps it not only to excel in low light, but also to capture gorgeous, sharp images and movies with beautiful background blur thanks to its circular 7-blade design. An updated lens arrangement with new lens coatings helps render images with excellent color balance, plus minimized ghosting and flare. Performance is brilliant, with a stepping motor (gear-type STM) to deliver near silent, continuous Movie Servo AF for movies plus speedy, smooth AF for stills. A redesigned exterior with improved focus ring placement makes manual focus adjustments a breeze. Canon's most compact 50mm lens, the EF 50mm f/1.8 STM has a rugged metal mount, plus an improved minimum focusing distance of 1.15 ft. (0.35m) and a maximum magnification of 0.21x. Offering sharp performance for the best in movies and stills, it's a fixed focal length gem—the perfect lens for photographers and moviemakers to expand the creative possibilities with their EOS cameras.

SPECIFICATIONS
 * Focal Length & Maximum Aperture: 50mm f/1.8
 * Lens Construction: 6 elements in 5 groups
 * Diagonal Angle of View: 46°
 * Focus Adjustment: AF with full-time manual
 * Closest Focusing Distance: 1.15 ft. / 0.35m
 * Filter Size: 49mm 
 * Max. Diameter x Length, Weight: Approx. 2.7 x 1.5 in. / 69.2 x 39.3mm, Approx. 5.6 oz. / 159g
